meanings.definition: A stone or concrete edging along a street or sidewalk.
meanings.sent1: The children sat on the curbstone while waiting for the school bus.
meanings.sent2: I tripped over the curbstone and scraped my knee.
meanings.sent3: The curbstone seemed to whisper secrets to the passing cars.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as solid as a curbstone.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight glinted off the smooth surface of the curbstone.

meanings.sent1: She had to curbstone her excitement to avoid startling the puppy.
meanings.sent2: The teacher tried to curbstone the students' chatter during the test.
meanings.sent3: He attempted to curbstone his laughter, but it bubbled out uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The urge to run wild was a beast he struggled to curbstone.
meanings.sent5: She managed to curbstone her fear and speak confidently in front of the audience.
